Languages like Ha (Harjula 2004: 132/3) allow up to two OCs (even though Harjula food of morning SC1-past-cook-appl-pass-fv Asha by Juma
notes that in Ha these structures are rare), see also ex (17) from Chaga above: `breakfast was cooked for Asha by Juma'

(32) ya-wu-mú-haa-ye [Ha] In contrast, languages like Chaga or Tswana are symmetrical, since both the
SC1.PAST-OC3-OC1-give-PERF benefactive and the theme object can follow the verb directly, both can be expressed
`She gave it to him' by an OC, and both can become subject under passivisation.
